item.title: Notes on a Remarkable Finding from Finland
item.description:
I recently came across a paper by Ursina Schaede and Ville Mankki that contains a fascinating empirical finding with major implications for the way in which we think about meritocracy. The paper examines the long run effects on students of a change in the manner in which their teachers were selected into a graduate program. Finland is well known for hav‚Ä¶

URL: https://rajivsethi.substack.com/p/notes-on-a-remarkable-finding-from?utm_source=substack&utm_campaign=post_embed&utm_medium=web

source: Against Meritocracy

Adam Gurri on Twitter

‚Äú@Noahpinion Like ‚Äúnorms,‚Äù which is very related, it‚Äôs used to mean a lot of different things. So it‚Äôs just about deciding which characteristics you care about and building your taxonomy from there. This (unironically, I know it‚Äôs crazy big) was the best for norms https://t.co/myQw5T4xwd‚Äù

item.title: Chartbook #60: Books we read in International and Global History HistGR8930
item.description:
Over the last few months I‚Äôve had the pleasure of teaching the introductory course on ‚ÄúApproaches to International and Global History‚Äù for the MA program that Columbia jointly runs with the LSE. It wasn‚Äôt a course I had taught before. But this is one of the fun things about teaching - the impulses you don‚Äôt expect‚Ä¶

item.title: The "Banker to the World" is Back
item.description:
